Line 44: Line 44:
The '''Egyptian parliamentary elections of 2010''' will be held in [[Egypt]] on 28 November 2010<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/10/201010201482298875.html Egypt elections set for November 28 - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name="Electoral calendar for 2010">[http://www.mherrera.org/elections.htm Electoral calendar for 2010]</ref><ref name="IFES Election Guide">[http://www.electionguide.org/country.php?ID=65 IFES Election Guide]</ref> while the second round of the elections will be held on 5 December 2010.<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election">[http://www.bbc.co.uk/arabic/middleeast/2010/10/101020_elections_egypt.shtml Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election - 20 October 2010 - BBC.co.uk<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name="Egypt opposition split over election boycott">[http://arabinform.org/news/egypt_opposition_split_over_election_boycott/2010-09-26-407 Egypt opposition split over election boycott - 26 September 2010 - Arabinform.org<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The '''Egyptian parliamentary elections of 2010''' will be held in [[Egypt]] on 28 November 2010<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/10/201010201482298875.html Egypt elections set for November 28 - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name="Electoral calendar for 2010">[http://www.mherrera.org/elections.htm Electoral calendar for 2010]</ref><ref name="IFES Election Guide">[http://www.electionguide.org/country.php?ID=65 IFES Election Guide]</ref> while the second round of the elections will be held on 5 December 2010.<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election">[http://www.bbc.co.uk/arabic/middleeast/2010/10/101020_elections_egypt.shtml Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election - 20 October 2010 - BBC.co.uk<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name="Egypt opposition split over election boycott">[http://arabinform.org/news/egypt_opposition_split_over_election_boycott/2010-09-26-407 Egypt opposition split over election boycott - 26 September 2010 - Arabinform.org<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
â
The election was scheduled in three-stages to form the Ninth Assembly since the adoption of the [[Constitution of Egypt|1971 Constitution]]. Four hundred and forty-four ordinary were seats being contested<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" /> with 64 additional seats reserved for women,<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" /> <ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" /> while the president appoints 10 members,<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" /> making a total of 518 seats.<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" />
+
The election was scheduled in three-stages to form the Ninth Assembly since the adoption of the [[Constitution of Egypt|1971 Constitution]]. Four hundred and forty-four ordinary were seats being contested<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" /> with 64 additional seats reserved for women,<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" /> while the president appoints 10 members,<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" /> making a total of 518 seats.<ref name="Mubarak sets a date for parliamentary election" />
{{Politics of Egypt}}
{{Politics of Egypt}}
Line 50: Line 50:
==Background==
==Background==
This election follows the Muslim Brotherhood completing the five-year parliamentary term in which it held on as the largest-ever minority bloc.<ref name="aljazmb"/>
This election follows the Muslim Brotherhood completing the five-year parliamentary term in which it held on as the largest-ever minority bloc.<ref name="aljazmb"/>
  +   +
==Electoral system==
  +
=== Single member plurality ===
  +
{{expand section|date=November 2010}}
  +   +
The '''plurality voting system''' is a [[single-winner voting system]] often used to elect executive officers or to elect members of a legislative assembly which is based on single-member [[constituency|constituencies]]. This voting method is also used in multi-member constituencies in what is referred to as an exhaustive counting system where one member is elected at a time and the process repeated until the number of vacancies is filled.
The election process will run in the three stages [[single member plurality]], with millions of registered voters in the 222 [[constituencies]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}}
The election process will run in the three stages [[single member plurality]], with millions of registered voters in the 222 [[constituencies]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}}
â
==Electoral system==
+
Most of the political parties in Egypt have been advocating for a [[Party-list proportional representation|Party-list]] while the NPD insisted on the ''Single member plurality''{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}}.

===Seat allocation===

{{expand section|date=November 2010}}

Initially the NDP scored only 40% of the seats, but many independents switched their political affiliation back to NDP giving it its soaring majority.{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}}

The election was criticised as being a "sham."<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2010/11/20101117115630882819.html How to win power in Egypt - Features - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The election was criticised as being a "sham."<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2010/11/20101117115630882819.html How to win power in Egypt - Features - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>

<!--===Candidate ban===-->
+
===Candidate ban===
  +
{{expand section|date=November 2010}}
  +
The ruling National Democratic Party (NDP)'s recent decision to ban three of its parliamentary candidates from standing in 28 November elections has kicked up a storm of speculation.
  +   +
The three candidates to be banned are Daker Abdel Lah, who had been running for the professional seats in Manshiet Nasser and Gamaliya; Islam Medhat, who had been running for the professional seats in the Abdeen and Moski constituencies; and Ayman Taha, who had been running for seats reserved for workers in the Bolak Abu al-Eila constituency.
===Election monitoring===
===Election monitoring===
Line 109: Line 120:
Several Muslim Brotherhood members arrested while putting up posters for a female candidate signalling an "attempt to silence the Islamic group." The Interior Ministry alleged that the arrests for violations against the ban on religious slogans from being part of any election campaign.<ref>[http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=19341 Egyptâs Muslim Brotherhood sees dozens arrested in latest crackdown - Bikya Masr<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> On November 19, Mena el-Bussal, an independent but Brotherhood-affiliated candidate, led a rally that was disrupted by police. Several hundred members and supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood were arrested.<ref name="aljazarrests">[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/20101119212833744148.html Hundreds held after Egypt rallies - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>

Several hundred members and supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood were arrested.<ref name="aljazarrests">[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/20101119212833744148.html Hundreds held after Egypt rallies - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
â
==Election==
+
===Election violence===
â
{{update|date=November 2010}}
+
{{expand section|date=November 2010}}
â
Early results showed the MB had not made any gains to its one-fifth position, with the ruling NDP consolidating its two-thirds majority in parliament. The MB<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/20101129102949839336.html No gains for Egypt's Brotherhood - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and other rights groups accused the NDP of "fraud and thuggery" to win.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/20101129182221768843.html Egypt election marred by fraud - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Essam Elerian, a MB spokesman, said that though the party "lost seats and a much deserved representation in the parliament...we won people's love and support and a media battle that exposed [irregularities in] the elections."<ref>[http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=27354 Ikhwanweb :: The Muslim Brotherhood Official English Website<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He also called the "clear vote-rigging an obvious election scandal by all measures."<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2010/11/2010112912557915300.html Egypt's winners and losers - Features - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
+
Nine people were also killed in election day violence.<ref>[http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=27350 Ikhwanweb :: The Muslim Brotherhood Official English Website<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
â
Nine people were also killed in election day violence.<ref>[http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=27350 Ikhwanweb :: The Muslim Brotherhood Official English Website<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Police also forcefully dispersed more than 1,000 people seeking to observe the vote-counting process in [[Mahalla]].<ref>[http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2010/11/29/election-day-mansoura Election day in Mansoura | Al Jazeera Blogs<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The following day, protests continued in Egypt.{{Citation needed|date=November 2010}}
+
=== Fraud allegations ===
  +
Police forcefully dispersed more than 1,000 people seeking to observe the vote-counting process in [[Mahalla]].<ref>[http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2010/11/29/election-day-mansoura Election day in Mansoura | Al Jazeera Blogs<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The following day, protests continued in Egypt.{{Citation needed|date=November 2010}}
Allegations of fraud on election day including vote buying, illegal campaigning at polling stations, exclusion of opposition supporters, especially those supporting the Muslim Brotherhood, and discarded votes are surfacing after the November 28, 2010 election. <ref>[http://therealnews.com/t2/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=31&Itemid=74&jumival=5942 Reed Lindsay reports Votes for Sale in Egyptian Elections on [[The Real News]] (TRNN)]</ref>
Allegations of fraud on election day including vote buying, illegal campaigning at polling stations, exclusion of opposition supporters, especially those supporting the Muslim Brotherhood, and discarded votes are surfacing after the November 28, 2010 election. <ref>[http://therealnews.com/t2/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=31&Itemid=74&jumival=5942 Reed Lindsay reports Votes for Sale in Egyptian Elections on [[The Real News]] (TRNN)]</ref>
  +   +
==Election==
  +
===1st===
  +
{{update|date=November 2010}}
  +
Early results showed the MB had not made any gains to its one-fifth position, with the ruling NDP consolidating its two-thirds majority in parliament. The MB<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/20101129102949839336.html No gains for Egypt's Brotherhood - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and other rights groups accused the NDP of "fraud and thuggery" to win.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/20101129182221768843.html Egypt election marred by fraud - Middle East - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Essam Elerian, a MB spokesman, said that though the party "lost seats and a much deserved representation in the parliament...we won people's love and support and a media battle that exposed [irregularities in] the elections."<ref>[http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=27354 Ikhwanweb :: The Muslim Brotherhood Official English Website<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He also called the "clear vote-rigging an obvious election scandal by all measures."<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2010/11/2010112912557915300.html Egypt's winners and losers - Features - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The United States expressed concern about the election.<ref>http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/201011305517283387.html</ref>
The United States expressed concern about the election.<ref>http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/11/201011305517283387.html</ref>
â
